intro: Gonostegia pentandra, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a milky sap that is toxic. Its flowers are typically tubular with five petals that curl inward, and it produces small, round fruits containing seeds. Gonostegia pentandra is often found in woodland and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
